findings.title: Classic reentrancy vulnerability in withdraw()
findings.description: The withdraw() function sends ETH via low-level call before updating the sender's balance. An attacker contract can re-enter withdraw() in its receive() function, draining the contract repeatedly before the balance is set to zero.
findings.recommendation: Follow Checks-Effects-Interactions (CEI) pattern: update balances[msg.sender] = 0 BEFORE the external call.

rootCauseDescription: State update after external call enables recursive withdrawal
